cause.description:
Objectivism is the philosophy of Ayn Rand, introduced first through her novels, "The Fountainhead," and "Atlas Shrugged," and later in several works of non-fiction. In Ayn Rand's words, Objectivism is "the concept of man as a heroic being, with his own happiness as the moral purpose of his life, with productive achievement as his noblest activity, and reason as his only absolute.
To learn more about Ayn Rand, Objectivism, or the Ayn Rand Institute, go to www.aynrand.org
The views expressed in this cause are in no way affiliated with the Ayn Rand Institute (ARI). ARI doesn't necessarily endorse any of the views contained herein.
1. Metaphysics: Objective Reality
2. Epistemology: Reason
3. Ethics: Rational self-interest
4. Politics: Capitalism
5. Aesthetics: Romantic Realism
cause.mission: Support the work of the Ayn Rand Institute in advancing the philosophy of Objectivism within our culture
cause.name: Objectivism
